content.description: This send requires fancy footwork. Start by finding undercling and stepping up into the crack with both feet. With your right hand still holding the undercling, turn your left side out from the wall, slowly extend left hand upward to crimp as you stand. Now you're at the crux. The rest of this is basically slope. Wrap right arm around the arete onto to slope. Position right leg higher, then pull until you hand grab the horn.
content.location: Starting at in the middle of the treeline, begin hiking straight up the hill. You should reach this boulder in about 5 minutes. You'll first pass the "Dirty Girl" boulder, and then a split boulder that has an overhand and a tree extremely close to it. Continue going straight up the hill. You should reach a bit of a clearing where you can see rock face up and to your left. To your right, you should see a boulder that looks almost like a triangle.

content.description: Sit start. Starting on the right side of the flake, find nice starting jugs. Grab the sharp flake, and swing your left leg onto the flake. This is the crux: find crimp up and to the left to pull youself on the flake. Grab horn to the top.
content.location: To the right of Captain Crimps. Starting at the treeline, walk right until you find an opening around when you reach the entry road to the lookout area.

content.description: Start on the right side of the boulder. Find crimp with left hand and cling with your right. Begin traversing up and to the left. The crux is one move before topping out; you either have to match a crimp or fully extend to the next hold.
content.location: Starting in the middle of the treeline, hike straight up the hill. In less than five minutes, you should find a rock with a slabby face. On the top is a little dirt and moss. To the left you can walk around and on top of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start. Starting close to the left arete, grab onto the sharp flake press feet against the rock. Pull yourself onto the top of the flake so that you are standing. Walk a litte up the right of the crack. Find SMALL crimps with right and left hand. The rest is a crimpy, adrenaline-inducing send. The crux is finding a crimp with your right leg and standing on it. It holds--if you trust yourself.
content.location: Starting in the open area, facing the treeline, follow the treeline right. As you reach the sloped dirt road, you'll see a small opening in the woods showing a large boulder. There is a smaller rock with moss as a sofa. You'll know this is the right place if the rock has a large, slanted crack running from left-to-right.

content.description: Slab climb that spits you outward if you fall--safe for beginners.  Start by finding little ledge for right foot and a crimp for right hand. Reach for a little numb up and to the left. Perform a split as you extend your left foot outwards. Adjust right foot to a higher, yet slanted-inward ledge. Reach above for flake with left hand and match. Move right hand to the ledge and pull yourself over.
content.location: Walk to the left side of the treeline. Find a boulder which has a sloped lip with a cave underneath. There will be a boulder to your left and a couple trees behind you.

content.description: Great for beginners and some high ball thrills. A secluded area at the treeline of the base of Bald Mountain. You should climb here on weekends or after 5:00pm on weekdays. [Current ownership status is unknown. R Hall NH Admin ]
